meanings.definition: A preparation of vegetables or herbs that have been cut into very thin strips.
meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled chiffonades of basil on top of the pasta.
meanings.sent2: She added some fresh chiffonades of spinach to the salad for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The salad was so fancy, it even had chiffonades of parsley dancing on top!
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streamed through the window, illuminating the chiffonades of carrots on the cutting board.
meanings.sent5: The colorful chiffonades of bell peppers made the dish look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: A method of cutting leafy herbs or vegetables into long, thin strips.
meanings.sent1: To make the dish, you'll need to master the art of creating chiffonades of basil.
meanings.sent2: The chef demonstrated how to chiffonade the lettuce for the salad.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was filled with laughter as the chef attempted to juggle the chiffonades of kale.
meanings.sent4: Her knife skills were so impressive that she could chiffonade a cabbage in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly cut chiffonades of mint filled the room with a refreshing scent.
